column4: I installed mplayer and codecs with automatix.  when mplayer plays an .avi the audio and video are out of sync but xine plays it right, how do I fix it?
try mplayer -autosync 30 whatever.avi
if that doesn't fix it, you can use +/- to adjust the a/v sync manually
you might find that '-vo xv' helps too
ok I will try those
-vo xv is worth using anyway
you can also do 'echo vo=xv >> ~/.mplayer/config to make it permanent, to save typing -vo xv every time
ditto, 'echo autosync=30 >> ~/.mplayer/config' if you want that permanent
RandolphCarter: it's still off, does mplayer on dapper work for you guys?
even with -vo xv -autosync 30 ?
yeah
what is it? avi is just a container; what does 'file whatever.avi' say?
RIFF (little-endian) data, AVI, 608 x 336, 23.98 fps, video: XviD, audio: MPEG-1 Layer 3 (stereo, 48000 Hz)
how off is it? 3 pass encoding had some bug that screwed the sync IIRC, I've seen ~200ms off sync quite often
sorry the last msg was for you forgot to lead with the name
sounds like the 3-pass thing - hit - a couple of times and it should be ok
yeah it was 200ms off, hitting - twice worked... is the bug you're talking about in mplayer ?
no, it was in mencoder's 3-pass encoding IIRC
do you know why xine plays it right ?
the problem is in the avi file; mplayer can deal with it, just not automagically
it does? no, I don't use xine
